tr.td: For the more easy Discovery and Conviction of such as destroy Game of this Kingdom.
Laws against Game not hereby repealed, executed.
Constable, by Warrant from a Justice, may search Houses of suspected Persons, as by Stat. 3 & 4 W. & M. c. 10.
If Hare, &c. be found, and Owner, &c. do not give a good Account, to be convicted by a Justice—Penalty—Distress—If no Distress, Imprisonment, &c.
Unqualified Persons having Greyhound, &c. Penalty—how convicted.
Gamekeepers authorized by Stat. 22 & 23 Car. II. c. 25. §2. may oppose Persons in the Night.
Persons not Owners of Fisheries, &c. not to keep Nets, &c.
Owner of Fishery may seize Nets, &c. used in his Fishery; and Persons authorized by him, or other Persons by Warrant, may search for Nets, and seize and dispose of them.
No Certiorari on Conviction, except Party convicted give £50 Security to pay Costs.
In Actions for executing Act, General Issue may be pleaded—Treble Costs.
Apprentices, Inferior Tradesmen, &c. hunting, &c. Penalties; and Trespass also lies.
This Act enforced, 4 & 5 Ann. c. 21. § 7. continued, 5 & 6 Ann. c. 14. § 1.
For the King and Queen's most gracious general and free Pardon.

entry.head: Glass Wares and Stone and Earthen Bottles See Customs. Ercise.
Gold and Silver See Multiplying Gold and Silver.

tr.td: Statute 10 Edw. III. c. 3. for finding Six Sureties for good Behaviour by him or her that hath a Pardon of Felony, repealed.
Persons pardoned, not excepting Femes Covert and Infants, to find Two Sureties.

entry.head: Goods and Merchandize exported and importedSee Customs.

tr.td: For the regaining, encouraging, and settling the Greenland Trade.
Power given to Persons mentioned in the Act to raise a Joint Stock of £40,000.
The said Persons made a Corporation.
To have a Common Seal, and capable to purchase Lands, &c. not exceeding £100 per Ann.
The Company may trade to Greenland, &c. Exception of American Plantations.
A Book of Subscription, and each Subscriber to subscribe not less than £500, not more than £2,000.
Money subscribed, how and when to be paid, within 4 Years.
Defaulters to enjoy only in proportion to Money actually paid.
Defaulters to forfeit £10 per Cent. on default, to be deducted out of what they have paid.
Choice of Governor and Deputy Governor, and Committees.
Oath to be taken by Governor and Deputy Governor.
Oath to be taken by Committees.
Subscriber of less than £500 no Vote, of £500 One Vote, of £1,000 and upwards, Two Votes.
Oath to be taken by Subscribers.
Governor, Deputy Governor, and Committees, to take the Oaths of Stat. 1 W. & M. Sess. 1. c. 8.
By whom such Oaths are to be administered.
General Courts and Committees, how to be called.
The Subscribers at a Court may make Bylaws.
By-laws to be observed, and not to be repugnant to Law.
The Sales of Goods to be public.
Once a Year at least, and by Inch of Candle.
The Monies arising from Sales to be fully applied.
Dividends to be in Money; Shares may be assigned by Entry in a Book kept for that Purpose, and may be devised.
No Person to sell a greater Share than he really hath.
Sales of Shares not perfected within Ten Days void.
Ships to Greenland may be navigated with One-third English, and yet not to pay any further Custom.
Greenland Ships not to have the Benefit of this Act, unless victualled for the said Voyage, and proceed direct.
Corporation to continue for 14 Years from 1st October 1693.
The Trade laid open, 1Ann. Stat. 1. c. 16. See 10 G. I. c. 16. which is extended to Davis's Streights for 7 Years, 12 G.I. c. 26. § 7.expired.

entry.head: Gunpowder, Arms, Ammunition, and Utensils of War

tr.td: Penalty on Importation of, without License from the King.
Repealed as to any of the Articles therein mentioned, being Manufactures of Ireland, 46 G. III. c. 121.
Obtaining Grant or License for sole making or importing, Premunire and Disability, and Grant void.
